heading: ingenie Business
body: This app was built when 'ingenie Business' required a B2B site for marketing their core telematics technology that powered ingenie Insurance product it offered to its own customer. The App was built in the latest Angular version at the time and used a NodeJS backend using Nodemailer to handle mail requests and responses. Both apps were unit tested and run through CircleCI before being deployed to Azure Cloud hosting.

heading: Shelias' Wheels Loyalty
body: Sheilas Wheels first native app built using the ionic framework and headless CMS. Marketing could then update current discounts and incentives as well as offer add-on products and services. Drupal was used as a headless CMS for marketing to manage with as little developer input as possible. The app was deployed on both AppStore and Google Play during a phase where esure were going through a digital transformation.

heading: ingenie custom rebuild and libraries
body: Complete rebuild of the ingenie brochureware site in Wordpress. Custom themed from scratch and intergrated style/component library. This project was assigned to me to do whilst carring out mmy normal day to day business at ingenie. Continuous delivery was set up using CircleCI and deployed to a managed Wordpress hosting platform. The component library helped non-tech people within marketing manged content and add complex blocks of functionality, as well as keep the simple html element unifom throughout the site.

heading: esure My Account
body: Part of team involved in the digital transformation to allow customer to access their insurance products details online and self manage. Involved in coding and testing of various parts of the app from login & authentication to dash widgets displays. The 'My Account' product was built for both Sheilas' Wheels and esure customers who could have home or motor insurance products with us. I was heavily involved in the design process as well as development.

heading: esure FNOL App
body: I was tasked with building this native hybrid app by a sponsor while working for the esure Group. After the success of the Sheilas' Wheels app and release, esure wanted to investigate oppotunities around savings with 'First Notice of Loss' app. This was built using the ionic framework and had features such as capture images/details at the scene, with the ability to send to esure and store your insurance details to share with other driver involved.
